intro: Agathosma mixta, commonly known as Cape geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has aromatic leaves that are used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils. Its ecological importance includes supporting local pollinators and contributing to biodiversity in its native habitat.
